metadata.title: Climate-linked Changes in Main Commercial Stock Fluctuations in the Atlantic and Pacific.
metadata.description: Global impacts of fishing on marine ecosystems can be reliably evaluated against the background of natural longterm changes, observed in these ecosystems.   Main commercial species (Peruvian, Japanese and Californian sardine, anchovy, pacific, salmon, walleye Pollock, Chilean jack mackerel, Pacific and Atlantic herring, cod, and some others) producing about 50 percent of world marine fish harvest undergo long-term simultaneous oscillations.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To show the climate-linked Changes in main commercial stock fluctuations in the Atlantic and Pacific.
